items: Attach a cable to a low pulley and select the desired weight.
Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the handle with an overhand grip and extend your arms in front of you.
Keeping your elbows stationary, curl your wrists back towards your body.
Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your wrists back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Switch hands and repeat the exercise with your other wrist.

items: Strengthens the wrist extensors, which are important for grip strength and wrist stability

Can improve performance in sports that require strong grip and wrist stability, such as tennis, golf, and weightlifting
Targets the muscles in the forearm, which can improve overall arm strength and size
Can be done with a variety of weights and resistance levels, making it suitable for beginners and advanced athletes alike
